data: No insertion or removal of any lines (including urinary catheter), procedures, or transport unless directed by ECLS physician
No nasopharangeal or oropharyngeal suctioning unless directed by ECLS physician
All bloodwork should be drawn from existing lines. No phlebotomy, subcutaneous injections, or removal of any tubes or lines unless directed by ECLS physician

Pre, Post,  deltaP oxygenator readings, venous access pressure readings q1h and PRN, ECLS blood flow rate, sweep gas flow and FiO2 readings q1h and PRN; visual inspection of oxygenator, lines and tubing with flashlight q1h and PRN
Check ACT within 5 min of starting ECLS, then q20min until it is within the ordered range, then check q1h and PRN

Temp goal: 36.0 to 37.0, pH goal: 7.35 to 7.45, PaCO2 goal: 35 to 45 mmHg, PaO2 goal: greater than 100 mmHg, SvO2 goal: 70 to 75, PIP (cmH2O): less than 20, Hct goal: 35,  Platelet goal: greater than 50,000 mm3, Fibrinogen (g/L) goal: greater than or equal to 1.5, ACT goal: 180 to 220 sec, Circuit negative access pressure not to exceed _____ mmHg
50% of Maintenance Fluids, Including PO and Enteral Meds/Fluids, Including IV Continuous Infusions, Includign IV Intermittent Meds
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
See most recent TFI orders, IV, drug form: bag
Discontinue heparin from central line if previously ordered
Discontinue heparin from arterial line if previously ordered

Routine for peripheral cannulation with chest drains in place

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
